intro: Leptodermis vestita, commonly known as the naked skin lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its leathery, foliose thallus that is typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant lacks distinct lobes and has a smooth, often bare upper surface, giving it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found on bark or soil in temperate regions. Leptodermis vestita is known for its slow growth and is commonly used in ecological studies to monitor air quality and environmental changes.
